object.name: BackgroundTypePattern
object.description: The background is a PNG or TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type 'application/x-tgwallpattern') pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.
object.html_description: The background is a PNG or TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type “application/x-tgwallpattern”) pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.
object.rst_description: The background is a PNG or TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type 'application/x-tgwallpattern') pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.

annotations.description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern
annotations.html_description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern
annotations.rst_description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern
annotations.name: fill

annotations.description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100
annotations.html_description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100
annotations.rst_description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100
annotations.name: intensity

annotations.description: True, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only
annotations.html_description: Optional. True, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. :code:`True`, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only
annotations.name: is_inverted

annotations.description: True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted
annotations.html_description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. :code:`True`, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted
annotations.name: is_moving
